abstract.text: A displayable representation of a Live Photo—a picture that includes motion and sound from the moments just before and after its capture.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: In iOS and tvOS, you can use this class to reference Live Photos from the user’s library (fetched with the
classes), to load displayable Live Photo objects from data obtained elsewhere (such as pictures shared through a social network), and to assign Live Photos to
In iOS, tvOS, and macOS, you can use this class to display edits in progress for Live Photo content in a photo editing extension.
For guidance on how to integrate Live Photos with your app’s user experience, see
class serves in much the same role for Live Photos as the
class serves for static images. A
object represents not the data file an image is loaded from, but instead a ready-to-use image that can be displayed in a view—similarly, a
object represents a Live Photo ready to display with motion and sound using a
object, not an entry in the Photos library or the data resources that constitute a Live Photo. (To work with Live Photos as elements of the Photos library, use the
class. To work with the data files that constitute a Live Photo, use the
To display Live Photo content on the web, use the

abstract.text: A high-level interface for manipulating image data.
Play Live Photos on the web.
An object that manages image data in your app.
Provide the same interactive playback of Live Photos as in the iOS Photos app.
Special values for the Live Photo request ID that are returned by asynchronous requests.
Info describing an attempt to load a Live Photo.
Work with image and video assets that the Photos app manages, including those from iCloud Photos and Live Photos.
A representation of an image, video, or Live Photo in the Photos library.
An underlying data resource associated with a photo, video, or Live Photo asset in the Photos library.
An object that facilitates retrieving or generating preview thumbnails and asset data.
A displayable representation of a Live Photo—a picture that includes motion and sound from the moments just before and after its capture.
Cancels an asynchronous request
Asynchronously loads a Live Photo from the specified resource files.
The size, in pixels, of the Live Photo.
A numeric identifier for an asynchronous Live Photo loading request.
A view that displays a Live Photo—a picture that also includes motion and sound from the moments just before and after its capture.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The protocol for implementing a class to allow an item provider to create an instance of the class.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A protocol that describes how a type interacts with transport APIs such as drag and drop or copy and paste.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A type whose values can be implicitly or explicitly copied.
